question: 1 (e)
sols_html:
Because of the absolute value in the integral, we need to split it at 0.

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle \int_{-1}^2|2x|dx &= \int_{-1}^0-2xdx + \int_0^22xdx\\ &= -[x^2]_{-1}^0 + [x^2]_0^2\\ &= -(0^2 - (-1)^2) + (2^2 - 0^2)\\ &= 1 + 4 = 5\end{aligned}\]
sols_latex:
Because of the absolute value in the integral, we need to split it at
\emph{0}.

\begin{align*}
\displaystyle \int_{-1}^2|2x|dx &= \int_{-1}^0-2xdx + \int_0^22xdx\\
&= -[x^2]_{-1}^0 + [x^2]_0^2\\
&= -(0^2 - (-1)^2) + (2^2 - 0^2)\\
&= 1 + 4 = 5
\end{align*}
